projects.title: Jisho Commandline Tool
projects.content:
Written in python, the code can be found here.
The project is a bit messy on github. The only important files are the main file jisho.py and the utils file utils.py.

projects.title: Game Feature Extractors
projects.content: Made at Field Day. This code can be found in the Field Day OpenGameData repository The extractors I built are called LakelandExtractor.py and JowilderExtractor.py.

projects.title: Tensorflow Japanese Image Classifier
projects.content: Code for this project can be found here.

projects.title: Jisho App
projects.content: The commandline tool (above) is nice, but is only ever usable from the commandline, which on windows doesn't even support Japanese characters very well. So I decided to port the functionality into an app! The app is still in progress but is written in Java and uses the  Model-View-Viewmodel along with a room database.

projects.title: Active Transcription Overlap Detector
projects.content: As an undergraduate persuing medical school, I originally worked in a biochemistry lab. After I decided to persue coding more heavily, I tried to transition from wet-lab experiments to more computational methods. One of those tasks was to adapt a Computer Vision matlab script from detecting Active Transcription Sites (ATS) to distinguishing between two flavors of ATS, complete ATS and incomplete ATS. I was able to present preliminary findings at the national ASBMB conference (pictured above). The paper has just recently been sent for publication.

projects.title: This Website
projects.content: This website isn't much, is written with simple HTML, bootstrap and flexbox CSS, a JSON file containing card data, and a javascript file to load the JSON.

blog.title: About Me
blog.content:
Originally I went to college to get a degree in biochemistry, but found I enjoyed computer science a lot more. I made the decision to focus on C.S. too late in my path to switch fully, and ultimately came out with a degree in Japanese with certificates in both computer science and biology.

I love baking. I speak Japanese.
